technology.title: HOW DOES THE TECHNOLOGY WORK?
technology.subTitle: The basis of the technology is the new seismic parameters, the law of seismic entropy production (SEM) and a specialized software LMTP-SPQ
data: The innovative technology is based on the method of seismic entropy (ITU), based on the new physical parameters and the concept of a seismic system (SS) introduced by S. Akopian into seismostatistics, within the framework of which a new law was revealed in seismology - the law of seismic entropy production (pdf).
A retrospective analysis showed that out of 750 strong earthquakes that have occurred in the world, 96% obey the new law.
The technology allows you to visualize the process of preparing strong earthquakes using the development of computer intelligence, thereby making a leap in the field of earthquake forecasting.

forecast_accuracy.title: FORECAST ACCURACY
forecast_accuracy.subtitlt: The forecast by the MSE is made within the framework of predetermined conditions:
data: The accuracy of earthquake prediction in time from 6 months to 1 week depending on the specific situation.
The accuracy of the forecast in magnitude of ± 0.1; large deviations are specified separately.
The accuracy of earthquake prediction at the place on the surface and at the depth of sources is limited by the size of the SS and can reach the size of the predicted earthquake.
If a strong earthquake waiting area is indicated within the SS, then a strong earthquake is automatically excluded in other places within the SS, i.e., the entire volume of the SS is controlled.
Depending on the development of the seismic situation, the forecast results may change and be refined over time.

Instability area (predicted earthquake location) can migrate within the SS from one fault zone to another, the predicted earthquake time can move away or approach and, accordingly, the magnitude of the expected earthquake can change (all this is placed in the method).

Elements of the SS in a limited time interval (from 1 to 6 months) can be in an unstable state, and if during this time a strong earthquake does not occur, the system will again return to a steady state.

ITU.title: Computer technology (CT) for global monitoring of seismicity, forecasting the intensity of the expected earthquake and the construction dynamic maps of seismic hazard based on the MSE
ITU.text: The method underlying CT is based on the introduction of new physical parameters calculated on the basis of seismic statistics; on the concept of a seismic system (SS), within which a new law – the law of seismic entropy production is formulated. A retrospective analysis shows that out of 750 historical strong earthquakes, 96% are subject to the new law. The new regularities make it possible to: steadily monitor the development of seismic instability in time and space; predict place, time, and force; eliminate earthquakes by 97% of the total preparation time; to monitor and evaluate a possible scenario for the development of seismicity; control trigger and technogenic seismicity; calculate dynamic seismic hazard maps; inform about the preparation of strong earthquakes, tsunamis and possible consequences.

SE_and_CT.title: SEISMIC ENTROPY METHOD (SEM) AND COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY (LMTP-SPQ) FOR MONITORING AND PREDICTION
SE_and_CT.subTitle: SEM allows to build a mathematical model of the geological environment (volume SS), due to which, for the first time in world practice, it becomes possible to visualize the entire process of preparing strong earthquakes
SE_and_CT.text:
The technology of monitoring and prediction is based on the law of seismic entropy production (Akopian, 2013, PDF). This law is viewed only within the framework of new seismic parameters calculated on the basis of the most reliable and transparent information – earthquake catalogs. It allows to build a mathematical pattern of the geological environment (SS volume), due to which, for the first time in world practice, it becomes possible to visualize the entire process of preparing a strong earthquake. 
The method of seismic entropy does not contradict everything that has been accumulated and developed by specialists in the field of earthquake forecasting and seismic risk reduction, on the contrary, it allows us to combine these efforts and significantly increase their effectiveness, increasing society's resilience to natural disasters, as well as from the point of view of effective allocation of finances and targeted preparation for strong earthquakes. 
Due to its versatility, the method already makes it possible to create a multi-level (global, regional, national and local) automated information system for seismic monitoring. Moreover, for well-defined seismic systems (for example, Italy, Japan, California), a reliable short-term forecast can be made. 
We believe that the seismic entropy method, by its universality, transparency, reliability and high efficiency, is just the tool on the basis of which seismologists and governments from around the world can already combine their efforts to develop common international norms and rules for forecasting, warning and taking measures in case of seismic danger.

preface.part1: The company “SeiEn” was established in October 2022 in Yerevan, Armenia (founders Akopian S.Ts. and Lalayan G.G.). It is the legal successor of the companies Earthquake Prediction Center (“GeoQuake’’ LLC, Moscow, 2007-2012), and International Center for the Global Monitoring and Forecast of Seismic Weather (“SeiEn” LLC, Moscow, 2018-2022), of which Akopian S.Ts. was the founder and CEO.
preface.part2: The main activity of the center is aimed at monitoring and forecasting earthquakes, assessing the seismic risk from expected earthquakes, and global reduction of damage from expected earthquakes and tsunamis through the introduction of innovative technology that contributes to increasing the resilience of society to disasters in the field of earthquakes and tsunamis. It complies with the strategy and charter of the UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (www.undrr.org) and fits into the frame of the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction for 2015-2030. (adopted at the Third UN World Conference in Sendai, Japan, March 18, 2015).
preface.part3: Our goal is to achieve a significant reduction in the death rate, reduce the number of victims and economic losses both in the region of Armenia and around the world.
preface.part4: We are ready to implement all our accumulated experience in the International Center for Global Monitoring of Seismic Risk to raise the resilience of the population of Armenia and other countries to natural and man-made disasters․

data.question: What is the new forecast strategy?
data.answer: - The new strategy allows to develop norms and rules of action in case of reliable short-term forecasts of earthquakes, considering the possible tsunami and damage. So, it is possible to regularly inform a people about the seismic situation in any region of the world, at the same time to report where it is potentially dangerous and where it is safe.

data.question: What is the accuracy of forecast?
data.answer: - The accuracy of the forecast depends on the reliability of the SS and the hierarchy of the identified subsystems. Today, in SS the forecast accuracy from 1 to 6 months, the magnitude of ± 0.1, is limited in place by the size of the system and the order of the size of the source. The accuracy of the negative forecast (when destructive earthquakes are excluded, and other forecasts are refuted) is very high.

data.question: It is possible to predict earthquakes in the short term?
data.answer: - Yes, in some cases this can be done today, depending on the nature of training. On average, every fifth earthquake can be predicted in the short term (from 1 to 7 days). This could be done, for example, for the earthquake of March 11, 2011 (Tohoku) in Japan.

data.question: What are the advantages of technology over others?
data.answer: - Because it is theoretically justified, universal, effective, transparent, and reliable, does not require large costs, because it is based on existing and renewable catalogs of earthquakes. It allows to visualize the process of preparing strong earthquakes, to control both the land and the ocean floor, practically tested on almost all seismically dangerous regions of the world. For all these indicators and the forecast accuracy, it has no analogue in the world.

data.question: How can forecasts be used to save lives and reduce the risk of damage?
data.answer: - The technology makes it possible to take a few preparatory measures before the expected catastrophe in the long, medium, and short term, as well as immediately after the catastrophe. These measures are developed based on the characteristics of the technology, considering the specifics of the expected earthquake and possible tsunami, as well as considering the level of development of the country prone to natural disaster. Technology allows effective development of parametric earthquake insurance.
